cluster represents the name of deployment belongs to.

Namespace represents which namespace the deployment belongs to.

kindName

The name of involvedObject.
If the kind is DEPLOYMENT,
this presents the name of deployments.
@inject_tag: v:"required#choose kind name"

parameters.name: type
parameters.description:
Type is used for query, showing events of specified type.
Use example: type=WARNING&type=NORMAL.

 - EVENT_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED: This is only a meaningless placeholder, to avoid zero not return.
 - Normal: Normal is a normal event type.
 - Warning: Warning is a warning event type.

parameters.name: eventType
parameters.description:
- EVENT_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED: This is only a meaningless placeholder, to avoid zero not return.
 - Normal: Normal is a normal event type.
 - Warning: Warning is a warning event type.

component.title:
Component from which the event is generated.
+optional

host.title:
Node name on which the event is generated.
+optional

EventSource.description: EventSource contains information for an event.

EventType.description:
Type of event (Normal, Warning), new types could be added in the
future.

 - EVENT_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED: This is only a meaningless placeholder, to avoid zero not return.
 - Normal: Normal is a normal event type.
 - Warning: Warning is a warning event type.

involvedObject.description: The object that this event is about.

reason.description:
reason is why the action was taken. It is human-readable.
This field cannot be empty for new Events and it can have at most 128
characters.

message.description: A human-readable description of the status of this operation.

source.description:
The component reporting this event. Should be a short machine
understandable string.

lastTimestamp.description: The time at which the most recent occurrence of this event was recorded.

type.description:
Type of this event (Normal, Warning), new types could be added in the
future.

autoAssign.description:
AutoAssign flag used to prevent MetallB from automatic allocation
for a pool.

avoidBuggyIPs.description:
AvoidBuggyIPs prevents addresses ending with .0 and .255
to be used by a pool.

status.description: Status defines the actual enforced quota and its current usage.

hard.description: Hard is the set of desired hard limits for each named resource.

GetResourceQuotaRespSpec.description: Spec defines the desired hard limits to enforce for Quota.

hard.description: Hard is the set of enforced hard limits for each named resource.

used.description: Used is used for each named resource.

available.description: Available is the amount of the quota that remains available.

GetResourceQuotaRespStatus.description: Status defines the enforced hard limits and observed use.

replicas.title: replicas represents elasticsearch's node set count

kind.title:
Kind of the referent.
More info:
https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#types-kinds
+optional

name.title:
Name of the referent.
More info:
https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/names/#names

ObjectReference.description:
ObjectReference contains enough information to let you inspect or modify the
referred object.

PermissionsType.title: 这个顺序和 GetPermissionsListResp.Permissions 一样，可以复制过来, 只保留顺序。不能打乱顺序,第一个永远是 None

PluginPluginName.title:
- PLUGIN_NAME_UNSPECIFIED: Enum unspecified.
 - HPA: The plugin name is HPA.
 - Insight: The plugin name is Insight.
 - GPU: The plugin name is GPU.
 - METALLB: The plugin name is METALLAB.
 - Spiderpool: The plugin name is Spiderpool.
 - CustomMetrics: The plugin name is CustomMetrics.
 - CronHPA: The plugin name is CronHPA.
 - VPA: The plugin name is VPA.
 - Hwameistor: The plugin name is Hwameistor
 - Flannel: The plugin name is Flannel
 - KubeOvn: The plugin name is Kube-ovn
 - OLM: The plugin name is olm
 - EgressGateway: The plugin name is egressgateway

PodCommonPodPhase.description:
- PHASE_UNSPECIFIED: This is only a meaningless placeholder, to avoid zero not return.
 - Unknown: PodUnknown means that for some reason the state of the pod could not be
obtained, typically due to an error in communicating with the host of the
pod.
 - Pending: PodPending means the pod has been accepted by the system, but one or more
of the containers has not been started. This includes time before being
bound to a node, as well as time spent pulling images onto the host.
 - Running: PodRunning means the pod has been bound to a node and all of the
containers have been started. At least one container is still running or
is in the process of being restarted. PodSucceeded means that all
containers in the pod have voluntarily terminated with a container exit
code of 0, and the system is not going to restart any of these
containers.
 - Succeeded: PodFailed means that all containers in the pod have terminated, and at
least one container has terminated in a failure (exited with a non-zero
exit code or was stopped by the system).
 - Failed: PodFailed means that all containers in the pod have terminated, and at
least one container has terminated in a failure (exited with a non-zero
exit code or was stopped by the system).

Status.description:
- PHASE_UNSPECIFIED: This is only a meaningless placeholder, to avoid zero not return.
 - Unknown: PodUnknown means that for some reason the state of the pod could not be
obtained, typically due to an error in communicating with the host of the
pod.
 - Pending: PodPending means the pod has been accepted by the system, but one or more
of the containers has not been started. This includes time before being
bound to a node, as well as time spent pulling images onto the host.
 - Running: PodRunning means the pod has been bound to a node and all of the
containers have been started. At least one container is still running or
is in the process of being restarted. PodSucceeded means that all
containers in the pod have voluntarily terminated with a container exit
code of 0, and the system is not going to restart any of these
containers.
 - Succeeded: PodFailed means that all containers in the pod have terminated, and at
least one container has terminated in a failure (exited with a non-zero
exit code or was stopped by the system).
 - Failed: PodFailed means that all containers in the pod have terminated, and at
least one container has terminated in a failure (exited with a non-zero
exit code or was stopped by the system).

waiting.description: ContainerStateWaiting is a waiting state of a container.

running.description: ContainerStateRunning indicates a currently running container.

terminated.description:
ContainerStateTerminated indicates a container that ran and completed
("stopped" in other contexts, although a created container is technically
also "stopped").

commonContainerStateRunning.description: ContainerStateRunning indicates a currently running container.

signal.description: Signal defines a signal that can trigger eviction of pods on a node.

reason.description: The reason for the condition's last transition.

commonContainerStateTerminated.description:
ContainerStateExited indicates a container that ran
and completed ("stopped" in other contexts, although a created container is
technically also "stopped").

reason.title:
(brief) reason the container is not yet running.
+optional

message.title:
Message regarding why the container is not yet running.
+optional

name.description:
This must be a DNS_LABEL. Each container in a pod must have a unique name.
Cannot be updated.

state.title:
Details about the container's current condition.
+optional

operator.title: Operator valid string: In, NotIn, Exists, DoesNotExist
Operator valid string: In, NotIn, Exists, DoesNotExist, Gt, Lt

effect.title: Effect valid string: NoSchedule, PreferNoSchedule, NoExecute
